<JD_START>
Job Title: Lead Propane CDL Delivery Driver

Location: Mayetta, KS

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Description:
 
This position is responsible for leading the day-to-day activities for self and other the delivery drivers by providing excellent service to customers in an efficient, timely and safe manner. Incumbent will serve as a backup to manager in daily office operations.
Responsibilities:Has responsibility for leading the daily activities and schedules for all drivers.As a driver, will load, secure, transport, deliver, and unload propane to and from specified destinations.Will be point- person for notifying manager and assist with scheduling needed equipment, supplies, or routine maintenance of trucks and vehicles.Prepares and maintains records in accordance with regulations and company procedures.Assists other drivers in handling and maintaining the flow of materials and products under strict safety guidelines.Leads activities for maintaining Service Center office and plant or yard for a professional appearance.Operates truck in accordance with established safety procedures.During daily interaction with customers, ensures both self and other drivers provide exceptional customer service by supplying service information and answering inquiries and questions. Requires on-call rotation for after-hours and weekend emergency deliveries or response.Leads all activities related to tank inspections, painting, repairs and loading of tanks. Assists manager in assigned planning and day-to-day operations of company.
Requirements: High school diploma or equivalentThree years related driving experience with Class A or B CDL with a good driving record required. NOTE: A Hazmat Endorsement also required (or the ability to obtain quickly upon hire)Two years supervisory experience requiredExperience in the propane industry strongly preferredMust have good financial acumen and a solid understanding of the businessMust possess outstanding customer service skillsMust have excellent organizational and time management skillsMust possess drive, determination, professionalism, excellent people skills, and the desire to be a significant factor in continuing to grow the businessMust be able to pass multiple pre-employment tests, including a background check and a Physical Capabilities Profile assessment.Must have reliable transportation and the ability to be at work even in adverse weather conditions.Must have experience using computers including email and other applications required. Regular and dependable attendance is an essential function of this position.Position requires working in all types of weather; must have the ability to work extended day hours, evening hours and weekends as needed in high peak season.
Physical Demands: Regularly required to sit and drive for extended periods. Will routinely stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Regularly lift and/or move up to twenty-five (25) pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to seventy-five (75) pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
Salary & Benefits: 
· Salary is negotiable based upon experience and qualifications
· Excellent benefits, paid holidays and Paid Time Off
Tribal Preference:
Prairie Band Propane is subject to Title 22: Employment Code of the Prairie Band Potawatomi Nation. In accordance with Title 22, this position is designated as a TIER 2 position. Preference will be given to individuals to the extent required pursuant to Section 22-2-4(B). To be considered for employment with Indian Preference, documentation is required to be provided at time of application.
PM21
#LLC
 
PI239176710

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
